cons:
Focus on main ventures lacking
Funding to improve infrastructure sometimes doesn't come by leading frustrating performance issues
Slow pace of development, too much redtape

headline: Don't know where this company is headed
pros: Nice people to work with. Also work is at a huge scale. Get exposed to many different cutting edge technologies.
cons: Bad management. It's  been utter chaos in recent weeks. In the recent layoffs they laid off newly hired people.

headline: Difficult turn around situation
pros:
- company tries hard to keep key employees via generous retention packages
- travel to remote offices is encouraged
- opportunity to move up management chain due to high attrition
- pay seems to be above average
cons:
- a lot of politics
- no vision, lack of direction, slow decision making
- takes too long to kill bad / obsolete products
- a lot of attrition recently - many smart employees left to join Google, Facebook, Microsoft, LinkedIn, etc.
- senior management musical chair / frequent change in direction / frequent reorgs

headline: Really high Highs.....really low Lows
pros: This is a pretty open environment to work in. I'm sure it heavily depends on the manager and team you work for, but from the few roles that I have held here, I'm free to work where I  need to and with the flexibility where I don't feel sufficated. The perks are pretty nice, the expresso bars are a nice touch, but the transportation benefits are awesome! When things are good, this is an awesome place to work for
cons: When things are bad, it's like walking around a funeral. It sucks being such a public company that is always under scrutiny by everyone waiting to break a news story. Aside from the some times bad press, there are some management issue. There seems to be a lack of leadership, which trickles down the ranks. Constant reorgs and project reassignments can get frustrating and demoralizing after awhile.

headline: Decent place to learn, but people are averse to accountability
pros: Yahoo has one of the best set of internal tools to help a developer and they should think about making these open source. There aren't many other companies out there that handle the amount of data that Yahoo does, and no one else has been doing it for longer than Yahoo. So if you are interested in Big Data this is one of the best places to work for the sheer scale at which they operate.
cons: The attrition rate is unbelievably high, the musical chairs that is the CEO's office is not helping matters. Senior management gets rewarded more for playing politics than for delivering new products/services. The technical leaders want to always play the safe game and just do enough to keep their jobs safe. Multiple teams are always working on similar projects even after the huge layoffs. Teams are very insecure about other teams stepping on their toes and there is not enough collaboration or communication between teams that are in different locations.

headline: Great Tech Company to work
pros: Friendly workplace, Great minds, Good facility
cons: Top management needs to be more settled

headline: It's a different experience altogether.
pros: Compensation is good but better are the facilities in this company which standout you can save much of your salary due to this how? free lunch & dinner is provided (they just cut Rs 10 a day which is equal to free with the range that they provide). Transport (Cab) facilities is outstanding since it is so flexible I may log off at any time since I don't need to worry about cab, they provide it any hour from 08.00 pm till 07.00 am in the morning and lastly brand name.
cons: When it comes to compensation there is no thing called as incentives here hike system is not so satisfactory, when it comes to leave only two choice you take either Paid leave or sick leave no casual leave on comp.. off.

headline: Unstable
pros: Very high profile and lots of unique visitors per month means every move you make can have a huge impact; lots of untapped potential at the company; Santa Monica office is a great location if you move to the area
cons: Company is very unstable; constant musical chairs in leadership and a lack of direction; lots of talent that is underutilized; no firm grasp of long-term goals as the company at least on the media side of the business focuses only on short-term gains.

headline: Challenging work on issues like scale
pros: They have good challenges problems to solve trying to make things works at scale, distributed fashion and very good technology stack.
cons: Stability of the company,things management does and declining revenues cause distraction at work.

headline: Display advertising business is run by slave driving managers and directors
pros:
Benefits: The free Coffee Bar is staffed.  Free Gym on campus .
Cafeteria is decent.
Company is not miserly when it comes to taking  care of employees.
Payscale is competitive.
cons:
Work Life imbalance. Company lacks direction. Losing focus on technology.
Google of the past. Now in catch up mode. 
Some businesses like the Display advertising business is run by slave driving managers and directors.
Do not care to put much effort in bringing new employees up to speed.

headline: Software Engineer
pros: The compensation is good. The perks are good. There is freedom to switch between different yahoo locations.
cons:
The culture is very boring and people really dont like to mingle with each other. Everyone works for a 9-5pm slot. 
The atmosphere is not challenging enough, the policies keep changing too often.

headline: Nothing gets done...
pros: Good pay, good lifestyle, work under 40 hours
cons: No future, company is done for.  Employees are parading out the door...

headline: Has been great as an engineer. There is so much to learn

cons: Management ca play a hinderance sometimes but  guess that is present in all the big companies at some levels.

headline: So much promise.

headline: Fast paced, always changing work environment
pros: No two days are alike in this fast-paced work environment.  Work is diverse and challenging with a global audience and impact.  Intelligent and articulate colleagues with managers who really do take a personal interest in your career.  Yahoo! is a major player despite its critics.
cons: Critics and negative media are the norm for this major player.  Project teams vie for limited engineering resources.  Layoffs are always just around the corner.

headline: Need to figure out leadership

cons: No leadership  or company direction

headline: The Premier Digital Media Company

- 700 million + monthly users.
- market leading products in many areas - Sports, News, Finance, etc.
cons:
- slow decision making
- longer ideation-to-market cycle

headline: a super speedboat with no rudder
pros: Yahoo's compensation and benefits are superb in relation to other media companies - and the fun factor rates fairly high, given the nature of the roles therein.
cons: There's no leadership, no vision and no integrity. The company has been and continues to be lost at sea, which is a shame considering the caliber of the people it employs.

headline: A good place to work
pros: Leading technology, you can work on top of many standard tools. Like to work in a big company with flexible working hours. Also, the pay is still not bad compared to previous companies I worked for.
cons: Bad management, relatively low morale. You got to motivate yourself, and learn how to work under layoff situation. Need to grow their business.

headline: Enoyable.
pros: Nice people, fun company to work for, you can make what you want of your career their if you put the effort in up o a point.
cons: Too much proprietary stuff sometimes limiting the ability to improve portable skills sets

headline: Highly mismanaged company
pros: You can get good salary.
cons:
Management is bad.
No direction to company.
Very mismanaged

headline: Satisfying
pros: competitive pay, nice working environment, work life balance, lot of opportunities
cons: poor leadership, lot of politics

headline: Still lots of opportunities to grow

- one of of the most visited website
- covers lots of technologies to address an incredible range of topics and challenges
- a great place to work for
cons:
- lots of turmoil these days unfortunately
- lack of stability of the decisions taken by senior management, shaggy execution and foggy plan

headline: Yahoo is an "OK" place to work
pros: Compensation is very good.  There are some extremely good engineers working at Yahoo.  It can be fun, but it isn't always.  In general I have loved working at Yahoo.  Just not sure what I think of it lately.  I'll have to see how Ross works out as CEO.  At least he's human and a reasonable on at that.
cons:
Management is in constant turmoil.
Promotions to Architect are very difficult to come by - it's more like an old boys club.
You depened on a lot of other teams doing their part for you to be able to ship.  Some of those teams are very poorly staffed and/or managed.  Those teams always seem to miss their dates and their code quality is poor.  There needs to be more accountability in the orginization.

headline: Very Good
pros:
Good working environment
Good learning opportunities, good engineers and scientists to work with
Competitive benefit 
Flexible working hour
Good professional management
cons:
The company suffers from a brain drain and miss-management
You may feel less prestige in working here rather than working for other rising companies

headline: Yahoo Rocks!
pros: The media give Yahoo a bad rap...it is an amazing company with some amazing people working there.  Their products blow the competitors out of the park.  Despite all of the changes, the moral is pretty good.  Once they are stabilized it will be a force to reckon with!
cons: A lot of changes all the time....

headline: Great engineers lead by highly incompetent upper management
pros:
1) Extremely knowledgeable colleagues around you. You will feel like a part of family.
2) Good compensation and perks
3) Good learning opportunity withing company
4) Large user base. Very few company operate on such a huge scale  
5) Very supportive and helpful managers (remember i said managers not executives)
cons:
1) Extremely incompetent upper management.
2) Frequent layoffs and restructuring. Almost every year.
3) Very low employee morale.
4) No vision, No direction from top management.
5) Company is bleeding talent. Every week I have to attend one farewell party.

headline: Where are we going?
pros: You are allowed to figure out your own ideal balance between work and play. Hours are very flexible, time off is generous, work early or late as you prefer. Many work from home.
cons: Poor direction. The last few years have seen projects released with no followup or maintenance, other projects restarted several times or cancelled close to release. There is no clear plan of attack for Yahoo's comeback. Subsequently we have lost almost all the "big name" web devs who used to be a selling point to incoming engineers.

headline: YAHOO!
pros: Employee compensation is above average in Asia
cons: Frequent layoff and re-org and low morale among employees

headline: Great company. Wonderful employees. Awful leadership.
pros: Yahoo treats it's employees with an enormous amount of respect and goes out of its way to try to do what's right for its employees. The positive values and culture within the company are a reflection of the values of it's co-founders.
cons: The worst part about working at Yahoo! is it's poor senior management, lack of vision, and the power struggles that happen between internal groups due to the silos within the company. These elements take a significant toll on employees and contributes to the low morale and frustration within the company.

headline: Good but not awesome
pros:
Can create impact on the lives of millions of people
Will solve all the problems at such a large scale
cons:
Non-transparency at management
Low reward for good work

headline: grey box/white box testing
pros: People are very helpful and friendly
cons: Most of important information are heard from the internet 1st

headline: Can't believe there are still so many good engineers after all those turmoil at top level...

cons: The turmoil at top level management is so distracting. reorg are too often because of this, causing a lot of knowledge loss.

headline: Good work life balance! Good compensation! Needs focus on product innovation!
pros: Good brand, good work life balance, opportunity to work on internet technologies, good compensation, compared to other internet companies in India Yahoo has comparatively lot of core product development in India and he will get opportunity to build  cool things.
cons: Financial struggle of the company and frequent leadership changes and organization changes causes a uncertainty and insecurity among employees. Once you are in a particular product/team it is not easy to change team and hence learning opportunities are limited.

headline: Chaotic.
pros: Great benefits, great pay, interesting work, generally very interesting projects.
cons: Upper management chaos, contestant bad press.

headline: The best of times.  The worst of times
pros: The overall compensation and benefits are quite good, what you would expect from a Fortune 500 tech company.  It's great to be able to work on products that are used by millions of customers globally as this presents unique challenges.
cons: The constant changes in the organization structure and leadership team were a distraction and drain.  Just when you would gain some momentum, you would reset.  One step backward to only take one step forward.

headline: Brilliant place to work
pros:
Fantastic culture
Amazing minds at work
Great people. Great mentorship. Great growth
cons:
Lesser pay compared to peers in industry
No definite direction
Weak management

headline: Very political environment. Managers will take credit for your work, and co-workers will backstab you to get ahead.
pros: Salary and benefits were very competitive.
cons: Constant reorganizations and layoffs made the environment even more cut-throat, and contributed to low morale.

headline: Good personal experience, less so for others.....
pros: Personally, I've had a very good experience working for Yahoo. I have been offered a number of promotions and gained a lot of valuable experience. However, although I believe that this is the product of my own hard work, it does occasionally seem that others have had less valuable experiences.
cons: Seems that if it can be over complicated, it will be. Recently there has been a complete lack of direction, confounded by the utter inability of the Senior Management team to instill any belief in the company, or in their skills as leaders. There is far too much bullsh*t rhetoric that at times seems to fly directly in the face of what we are being told. However, if you can cope with this, then its fine.

headline: good culture
pros: culture, gym, campus, on-site amenities
cons: the continued changes in leadership and focus

headline: Good
pros: New technologies and smart people
cons: Rapidly changing directions and organization structure

headline: Nice
pros: Talented people industry standard technologies
cons: Layoffs, poor management decisions, perks

headline: A very flexible place to work but he senior management team and board are incompetent as far as I am concerned.

cons: Business and engineering processes are nearly non-existent.  I could probably write a book on all of the problems within Yahoo.

headline: Good
pros: dynamic, and fun place to work
cons: lack of focus and diversity

Have the opportunity to address very large audiences around the world
Opportunity to develop new products in a large scale
cons:
Classic 'ivory tower' behavior by senior management
Senior management believes they know it all and do not seek opinions and advice of their people on the ground

Great work culture
Good management of work-life balance
Great support from colleagues 
Technically sound people; so a lot to learn
cons:
Too much panic situation in upper management
Insecurity in the mind of employees because of frequent lay-offs
Too many stupid decisions taken in too less time and going nowhere even after doing that
Wasting talent, letting go brilliant minds who end up joining competitors

headline: Neutral
pros:
Decent pay
Smart team
Good job life balance
cons:

headline: Vibrant tech company with a bit too much politics.

cons: Many not so great people to work with.  There is a little too much politics in the company.  There is a sort of identity crisis for the company - trying to reclaim former glory.

headline: A diverse and collaborative environment that allowed me to be creative and make positive contributions.
pros: Diversity of work, exposure, opportunity.
cons: beauracracy, process, lack of decision making.

headline: Overall, good, but it wore on me after 4 years of constant change and poor management decisions
pros: A dynamic high energy company when things are good.  Smart and creative people with nice camaraderie.  Great world wide brand recognition.
cons:
Lacks a clear vision of what the company is all about.  The sooner they figure this out, the sooner they can focus their resources in the right direction.

INNOVATE - come up with something that is game changing

headline: Just keeping the ship afloat
pros: A company with a lot of great history, interesting technology, and a few dedicated and smart people. Generally good pay, perks, and total compensation.
cons: A lot of people are complacent. While there are new products launched with regularity, few of them are noteworthy. The company is very interested in protecting their revenue, but not very interested in innovation.

headline: For every person supporting you, there are two trying to get in your way
pros:
Lots of creative people (still!).
One of a handful of companies actually trying to do things at global scale.
Commitment to contribute to open source and community activity.
cons:
An organization that was designed to perpetuate conflict. Incredibly hierarchical: flatten, flatten, flatten!
"The perfect is the enemy of the good... so let's prevent people from doing merely good things." AARGH!
Still convinced that they are so different (big, differentiated) that they have nothing to learn from others.

headline: Disappointing results, transient workforce and odd mix between being a great place to work and very frustrating place.
pros: Treat employees well, great facilities, services, etc.
cons: Constant churn at the top, changes in directions, unclear decision making, wasted resources, etc.

headline: Good learning experience at a company which impact life of millions of people

Technology and scale of problems at yahoo
Energy of a start up
cons:
Too much in flux
uncertainty
lack of innovation

lack of respect towards smart people
lack of efforts to maintain top talent
Too much emphasis to hiring friends in management rather than diversity

people are friendly

good team collegue

headline: Yahoo is the place to be if you want to innovate without boundaries

cons: Given that Yahoo is not at its peak - business wise, you have to deal with a lot of unnecessary pressures. But it also gives a rare opportunity to perform and deliver.

headline: neutral
pros: Good professional development. Was able to learn a lot which is definitely valuable for next job hunting.

headline: hard to get anything done.

headline: Overall I had a good experience and wish them the best.

headline: Yahoo has been a tremendous growth opportunity for me
pros: Great benefits.  Intelligent People. Working on large scale projects.  Flexible hours.  Many opportunities for growth.  Ability to work from home.
cons: The business has not been well run by senior management in years.  With regular layoffs, it is sometimes very stressful.  You never know if you are next on the chopping block.

headline: Good place to work
pros:
Top 5 reasons to work at Yahoo!

1) Flexibility of work schedule/hours - work/life balance
2) Scale: the experience you gain from working at this scale, is priceless
3) Amenities: free coffee, gym, onsite cafeteria
4) Culture: people take care of one another
5) Diversity - you can really move around in the company and acquire different skills
cons:
1) The affect the external media has on the internal mood of (some) employees is disappointing.
2) Despite the (positive) changes, and continuous improvements made in selected areas - the internal sentiment has not changed.
3) The need for the company to find an "identity" (or the expectation of the outside that it needs to have one...)

headline: lot of uncertainty
pros: talented coworkers, good work culture
cons: uncertainty, good people are getting let go or leaving

headline: worthy
pros:
work and life balance
career growth
products for millions of users across globe
internationalization vs globalization
mentoring
take risk
opportunities
cons:
weak management
no vision
weak tech
talents leaking 
weak understanding of users outside US
too many layoffs
indecisive top management
lack of insights

headline: Yahoo was the foundation of front-end engineering
pros:
Front-end engineering, as a profession, started in Yahoo. 
There's great pride in the work people do 
There's little politics at the engineer level.
Opportunity to move around and work with other teams.
Yahoo supports open source software.
cons:
Too many layoffs and restructuring.
There should be more options, bonuses, and incentives to keep loyal employees.

headline: Awesome Feeling to work with Big Thinkers
pros:
Its really a good place to work, where we are motivated enough to come up with hack ideas that can be productized. However, it is different part of the story that, most of these initiatives are killed or not considered immediately when they reach VP and SVP level.

Anyways, one always feels proud to work here, and amuse his speculative mind
cons:
- Big Thinkers all around but sometimes they fail at execution
- Management needs to expedite the process of bringing things into production

headline: Yahoo *used to be* the best place for research
pros: Yahoo! used to be the best place for research, providing a unique opportunity to have both external visibility (publishing) and internal impact (products).
cons: The new management of Yahoo! under Scott Thompson does not seem to value research any more. The quality of engineering and product management have also shown a slow but steady decline over the last years.

headline: The old hero fading away
pros:
Nice benefit for employee 
Flexible working hours
cons: Uncertain future with management frequent re-org

headline: The company overall is a great place to work for, despite the short sightedness of its executives and board of directors
pros: some really smart colleagues, very good compensation and excellent health care package, relax atmosphere, work / life balance
cons: senior management and executives continue to make mistakes after mistakes...they never seem to learn.  it's hard to work for a company that you know is not going to go anywhere...

headline: Large but declining talent pool and questionable senior management
pros:
- There are still a lot of talented people who are here given the size of the company.
- Yahoo! still has a large user base and provides rich playground for addressing 
challenging problems such as scalability, security and user experience.
- Balanced work and life.
cons:
- Many talented people have left
- Continuous organizational changes and focus shift
- Too much time spent on planning

headline: enchanted roller-coaster ride
pros:
people are fun and open-minded,
enjoy working with peers around the world, a global company with many international working experience
enjoy the life in beautiful campus
cons: direction keeps changing and changing ...

headline: good to go for digital but too many changes
pros:
It has a fun company culture and smart employees around  
Generally it is open to new business model 
Global experience through it's worldwide network
cons:
Too often org changes might confuse your work scopes 
Management groups are also often reorganized so that directions are unclear

headline: wonderful

headline: Too much politics

headline: Stagnant, immature and mismanaged enviornment in the corp apps(oracle) support group
pros:
It's Quater1 of 2012 when writing this review so a new CEO has just joined in
Casual dressing 
good Cafeteria, good food
cons:
No Standardizations or documentations in place some people who are here from a long time are the knowledge hoarders and have a very snotty attitude.
No communication horizontally or vertically is promoted within the teams.
When i joined new here I was not even guided on how to get a security badge or login password for the system..but this is team specific attitude.
Overall the processes in place are very lame with no heading or goals. 
Managers are not leading by example. It's jut to lame and cold enviornment here.

headline: Such a great brand, but such a mess
pros:
The brand
The location
The industry
The experience
cons: A total disaster in terms of company direction and strategy.  These people have no idea what business they're currently in and what business they WANT to be in.The talent drain in recent years has hurt a lot too. Keep that resume up-to-date.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Friendly atmosphere. Casual attitude. Great Brand
cons: Management not supportive in most of the cases

headline: Excellent experience
pros: experience of working in fast-paced environment
cons: Did not like too much lay-offs

headline: good exposure to business problem domain and gain opportunity to work on large projects
pros: good exposure to business problem domain and gain opportunity to work on large projects
cons: project moves too slow, no vision

headline: very friendly and flexible
pros: great people, collaborative, flexible work environment.  The strength of yahoo lies in its employees. This is what brings me to work daily..
cons: strategy changes are too often,  time to market is slow. innovation is not properly used or projected by business. vision , mission and execution are in misalignment

headline: Awesome
pros: Awesome teams of really smart people.
cons: Not good enough company strategy in leveraging the talent.

headline: awesome people - excellent work life balance
pros: Very good set of engineers, huge learning opportunities.
cons: Too many contractors spoil the good work of full time employees.

headline: My experience has been very positive.
pros: The company is focused on innovation and growth. They care about their employees. They also have tried to make employees feel like they are part of a larger family.
cons: There is some level of uncertainty because of many changes. The changes make some people concerned about the future and direction of the company.

headline: A big company with some big products and challenges, but with serious problems on execution and a fading brand
pros:
Great work environment specially in regards to a work-live balance. 
Great teams with talented and smart people
Good benefits (Gym, Cheap Food, Health, Dental, 401k 1.5 match) and comp inline with the market and sometimes higher then the average.
Working on some of the biggest products on the Internet with hundreds of millions of users
Working on high scale and high performance challenges
Lots of learning opportunities with you have a good coach/manager
cons:
- It is a slow company, everything takes forever to happen
- Old tools and platforms that are never finished.
- Bureaucracy is everywhere, nothing is simple to fix and to do
- Lack of resource planning, layoffs followed by a huge number of hires.
- The vision is not challenging or bold enough
- Some people are just tired and there is a big attitude problem.
- Lack of Focus, doing too much and spread too thin.
- Discipline driven Orgs (Design, Engg, Product, Marketing), it's very difficult to get alignment and execute on this.

headline: Educating and Fun!
pros: Great work environment and flexibility. Lots of internal tools and packages to learn. Huge footprint of data and hardware.
cons: Always in the downside in the media. Frequent layoffs. Too much bureaucracy at times. Less bonuses.

headline: Lots of Opportunity
pros:
* Amazing scale
* Highly dynamic industry
* Turbulent times offer opportunity!
cons: * Turbulent times make it a rocky ride

headline: Good fun and challenging
pros: Fun workplace, also I enjoyed working with my co-workers
cons: too many layoffs lately and lack of vision

headline: 5 Years and loving it
pros: love the flexibility of being this company! I always wake up and want to go to work. My clients are a pain, but my co-workers are great. Overall, a very good job.
cons: its a big place, so sometimes things aren't so easy. There is a bit of the start up mentality still there, but not always. Everyone is empowered to say "no" instead of "yes"

headline: Terrible place to work
pros: The benefits are good but not much else. Frankly, Yahoo is one of the worst places I've ever worked in my entire career. The management churn and constant re-organization is abominable. I had five managers in the space of eight months, the last of which laid me off under false pretenses, pretty much because he didn't like me personally. This after seven years of success with the company.
cons:
Yahoo HR absolutely lied about my being placed upon a PIP before being laid off. (PIP=Personal Improvement Program.) The HR rep said that I'd be placed on a PIP with an opportunity to "improve" before any lay-off. Lies, lies. I never had any PIP in place before I was suddenly "laid off."

Even though via the lay-off I was provided with an opportunity to re-hire with Yahoo, I would never, ever think of doing so again.

Unless you're a newbie just starting out and you don't know any better, stay away from this company. They'll screw you at their earliest opportunity.

headline: nice place to work
pros:
- relatively easy to propose new ways and solutions
- great colleagues, open environment
- very interesting problems to solve
cons:
- disorganized
- no long term strategy
- a lot of legacy
- slow to change its ways

headline: Great experience, place to learn, awesome collegues
pros: You get to influence the internet experience of literally millions of people around the globe!
cons: Large organization, too many meetings on a daily basis.

headline: Great work environment where you get to work on pretty cool stuff
pros:
Great people, easy to work with and exchange ideas
Great office environment
cons: Like a lot of big global companies you need to have meetings/calls with people in multiple timezones which can be logistically challenging

headline: Good experience at a leading web media company
pros: Lots of good engineers.  Solving scaling problems only a handful of companies deal with. Good work environment. Good benefits.
cons: Continual regular reorgs.  Useless leadership and board that never inspired. Failure to provide momentum in products.  Long product cycles and lots of failed or late projects.

headline: Struggling to find its place in the world
pros:
Good place to understand the online media business.  
Its name still looks good on your CV. 
Your immediate workplace collegues are bright, committed and collaborative
cons:
Feels like senior management team in the US are struggling to redefine the business. 
Often their thought processes and the employee communications seem very US centred, and that Europe or Asia hasn't entered their thinking.

headline: reasonable place to work
pros: good engineering team and working culture
cons: management lack of leadership and managers lack of people skill

headline: herding cats
pros: Loyal Yahoos have an amazing pride and faith in their company.
cons: Very chaotic.  No direction.  Lack of good business hygiene.  Finger pointing.  Fear of failure.  Revolving door of leadership leads to continual changes in direction and inability to complete anything.

headline: very satisfied
pros: Fantastic company with great opportunities for growth, learning and advancing career. Highly competitive compensation package and great benefits, which include Stock Options, ESPP, matched 401.
cons: Fast-paced, demanding and rapidly changing environment.   In some cases employees may need to work odd hours and the work can go beyond 40 hours a week.

headline: Great people, but poor talent management and career development
pros: learn internet business models; great people
cons: management lacks strategic vision and career development processes

headline: Positive
pros: Great Culture and love the purple
cons: Matrix environment, which leads to slow decisions

headline: Talent Acquisition is considered as a strategic function to support the company growth and development.
pros:
we have great people and great minds!
it's a very friendly environment where everyone is comfortable to express ideas
cons: constant challenge to compete in a very agressive industry

headline: Slow to change...
pros: My particular job is pretty stable. It's a great place to put down roots.
cons: Because my particular job is fairly stable it is next to impossible to move up the corporate ladder,

headline: Interesting Times
pros:
Smart Workers
A Lot of Untouched Value
Employee Engagement
Great Facilities
Rich History
cons: Bad leadership decisions from past taking toll on employee morale

headline: Great Place to Work
pros: Great place to work because you're working with great people.  The facilities are fantastic.  Innovation was always appreciated and rewarded.
cons: Sometimes the higher ups were out of touch with the users of Yahoo and they didn't quite understand that recruiting people to Yahoo wasn't the attractive proposition they thought it was.

headline: Awesome company to work for
pros: Great benefits and compensation, interesting projects, leading edge technology.
cons: Uncertainty about the future, executive management focuses on a abstract strategy not a product or market.

headline: Great Employee Perks, The Schmooze Game Is Big Here
pros: Great benefits--health, vision, dental, coffee bar, summer activities in the courtyard, happy hour, very liberal and progressive atmosphere
cons: Not everyone is recognized for the hard work they put forth unless you are a part of your manager's inner circle. Upper management says one thing, but your manager and all of the various local manager and directors are going to do whatever they want even if it's not for the good of the company. Yahoo! in general suffers from lack of good direction.

headline: good and bad
pros:
people are nice. there is a social norm to "be nice" and it shows.
challenging industry.
my line managers do sincerely care.
cons:
people are too nice/polite sometimes, which gets in the way of business effectiveness.
distractions at corporate level.
sexier, more glamorous, better-paying competitors.
sometimes too unwieldy and slow-moving.

headline: Good, but could have been better.
pros: Brand name and the job profile that I was given.
cons: Some of the employees are too laid back

headline: The hole is just too deep to dig out by yourself.
pros:
Working on petabytes of data. 
Free coffee
Good company recognition outside of North America.
By and large, friendly staff and non competitive culture. (read collaborative).
cons: Leaks. Non stop leaks. You find out more about the company from AllthingsD then you do from your management. The word "Yahoo" is used as the antonym of "Google" in North America. Large number of "obstructionist" long time Y! employees. These are the ones that have mastered the art of doing as little as possible while looking busy. Most are waiting for that all elusive layoff package or for their green card to be approved. More red tape then your local government. Their idea of automation is to manually push twice a week. Wide and i mean wide technology stack. 1 department can have mind numbing number of technical solutions for the same problem.

headline: Nice working environment with a lot of uncertainties
pros:
- Overall good package and employee benefits
- Good work life balance
- Managers are friendly and easy to approach
cons:
- Management and org keep changing.
- Getting harder for career development in current situation
- High turnover rate

headline: Great,Only if it had better mangement.
pros: One of the best places to work. Great work environment. Great things to work on. Great Products.Great People to work with,
cons: - Only if Yahoo had better decisive stable management -- it would still be a great competitor to likes of Google.

headline: Pretty Good.
pros:
-Fun place to work
-Surrounded by talent
-Respected company
cons:
-Upward mobility
-Employee morale
-Unable to keep their talent

headline: Great!
pros: Employee care is excellent! Personal growth too!
cons: Leadership is not so strong. Poor in execution.

headline: OK place to work
pros: There are still capable engineers left at Yahoo.  There is not much supervision from managers, which is a plus in my opinion.
cons: Some people take advantage of the lack of supervision and get away.  Also the appraisal process is a big joke, as the company takes 5 months annually to do the reviews.

headline: Fine employee experience, questionable decision making by executives, slightly low basepay
pros:
- Excellent benefits package
- High quality in-house developed application stack
- the full dot-com corporate culture :-)
- many skilled and dedicated engineers
cons:
- Uncertainty in the company road map
- A bit on the low-side for base pay
- Questionable Executive-level decisions
- Product managers seem oblivious to the concept of a rational product cycle

headline: Laid off without being given any reason
pros: Fun place to work with other poor saps.
cons: No communication or warning from management.

headline: One of the best places to work for
pros: - atmosphere, quality of colleagues, ideas
cons: - discouraged by the bad press

headline: disorganized
pros:
good pay - above average for valley prob
good benefits - no complaints
good people - although leaving
laid back atmosphere
cons:
incompetent management
too much management - how many Senior Directors and above?
unfairness in promotions/compensation
reorgs - expect a new manager every 6 months or so
layoffs - expect at least 1 a year

headline: Great company culture and activities
pros:
Managers are down-to-earth and really nice
great pantry
Friday bash can be fun
Smart and nice colleagues
Good technology
cons:
In Beijing it's usually fixing bugs
Not so much creativity
Product details are not optimized

headline: Good internship, middling company
pros: The internship was challenging and interesting and you were surrounded by really knowledgeable people. Overall good experience for my future career, and a good line to have in your CV
cons: The uncertainty around Yahoo's situation was very disturbing. Some parts of our project got cancelled because of rearrangements in Yahoo's assets. A lot of people were on the fence about staying or leaving.

headline: Good company, lousy morale.
pros:
- Great benefits
- Talented people
- Good work / life balance
- 401K matching
- Tuition reimbursements
- Creative culture
cons:
- Times Square location sucks (too much foot traffic, tourists, etc.)
- Company morale is very low
- Multiple leadership shakeups with no clear direction

headline: Great atmosphere, strong professionals
pros:
A lot of talented people working there.
Very good atmosphere.
A lot of place for innovation and high degree of freedom.
cons: The future of the company is pretty vague...

headline: Top heavy company
pros: Lots of free coffee, plenty of employee events, and casual work environment. Be prepared to wear lots of purple.
cons: Very top heavy management, some of the people there don't have any people or projects to manage so they just look like they're floating around.

headline: Yahoo! is an [re-] up-and-coming innovative company that needs to find its path in 2012.
pros: Great benefits package-- health, vacation, holidays, office space, etc.
cons: Some employees who have been with Yahoo! for years and years are set in old ways and processes.  They are the ones that are holding Yahoo! back from advancing in sales, social media, email, and overall consumer engagement.

headline: Inspiring and Rewarding
pros: Yahoo! definitely deserves the title as premier digital company. Both inside and out, the company tries its upmost to provide the best service to both it's clients, employees and stakeholders. A truly magnificent organization that has shaped todays web.
cons: Highly dynamic industry bringing much uncertainty with recent shake-ups in structure from top-down however this is very much part of the Internet industry overall.

headline: Fun place to work and interesting...
pros:
- Interesting work and challenges
- Massive compute and storage scale
- Training, conferences, travel ops just enough to keep things interesting not overwhelming
- Employees treated like "gold".  2x better than any of my past employers
- Good work/life balance on most teams
- Excellent compensation and benefits
cons:
- Lots of churn in management.
- Lots of churn in staff, mostly old timers tired of change.

headline: A good environment with employees in need of direction
pros: Great environment, young, energetic, people's attitudes, in New York and other big cities. It has a recognized brand name and a great asset in being the most home page site on the web.
cons: The company is disorganized, no strategy or consistency, given that there is too much turnover in management and all the way down. In addition, systems need a complete makeover.

headline: not a great place anymore
pros:
Great base compensation
people are fun to work with
great work/life balance
cons:
Rewards for high performance were horrible last year
no room to grow, company is shrinking and directors and vps have been there forever
no clear direction on products from executive team
constant reorgs
a lot of career instability with a lot of movements
quality of people is decreasing
a lot of mid-level mangers are very close minded and are from a different era
hr department is useless for dealing with conflict
your job is always on the line after a reorg, wether you're a good performer or not
constant saving on ridiculous things is tiring. meanwhile we always have money for our top execs
very political

headline: Chaotic place.  Great work environment.
pros: Great onsite perks - gym, cafeteria.  Great offices.  Good co-workers.  Employees are treated with respect.  Fun environment.  Company was open to doing things differently.
cons: Constant reorganization.  Lack of clarity in company's objectives.  Selfish senior management (VP and up).  Highly political. Terrible parking.  Decisions didn't "stick".

headline: Good
pros: Good people to work for and with.
cons: Uncertain environment. We need to be a media company.

headline: Long hours, good teammates, not so good management
pros: Free snacks, benefits are ok, teammates are fun to be around
cons: Long hours, stressful environment, poor company vision

headline: A great place to work and grow in your career
pros:
- Very smart and pleasant colleagues.
- Interesting work -- Y! still has a number of the leading web properties in the US and WW.
- Generally collaborative and friendly culture.
- Great pay and benefits.
cons:
- Within Silicon Valley, the brand has suffered a lot and it is not as 'cool' to work at Y! is it is at FB or G. (Outside of Silicon Valley people recognize it as experience at a top company + like the brand a lot and tend to think it is very cool that you have worked there.)
- Multiple re-orgs can be tiring, but hopefully that's behind Y! with the new CEO as of early 2012.

headline: Absolutely the most fulfilling experience I have had
pros:
- They reward high performance very well
- Co-workers are very talented and knowledgeably, so I was always learning from them. Because getting a job at Yahoo is tough (Used to be that 1 job given per 100 resumes), the quality of people here is of high caliber.
- Possibility to work with multiple teams, so you can work on more than one project at the same time and keep life interesting
- Career growth and goals are taken seriously, I moved on from Software engineering to Research position gradually
- Competitive perks and salary
- Fun informal environment
cons: - Media coverage of the company since 2008, The inside reality of the company is completely different from how its portraid in the media.

headline: Great Place to Work!
pros: Some of the best things about Yahoo! was the relaxed and comfortable environment. Also there was always free treats, such as candy and pop and free lunch. It was a place where you actually woke up every morning wanting to go to work.
cons: Some of the downsides were parking issues and sometimes having to "makeup" work for yourself. Other than that there is nothing else bad to say about the company.

headline: gone bad to worse
pros: OK compensation and good benefits . also yahoo as a brand is known all over but otherwise there is no good reason to join and keep working for this company
cons: nepotism and low employee morale. also stock options and RSU are uselss. frequent layoffs which target  'non-ass-kissing' employees. overall a pretty bad place to work

headline: Nice place to settle but avoid if you want to grow.
pros: Fairly stable. Pay, benefits, and workload is reasonable.  Has good community of frontend engineers where you can grown in that area.
cons: Management clueless.  Teams not united.  Each functional team only cares about their own interest: architects want to push their latest-and-greatest platforms, VPs only care about test code coverage to satisfy minimum requirements, QA only care about process, PMs only care about launching new features (whether they make sense or not).

headline: Pretty good
pros: cool technology, massive scale, good people
cons: uncertainty, lot of hiring at higher levels limits growth opportunities for current employees

headline: Could have been better!
pros: High level of talents but wasted
cons: REALLY bad management, need smarter leaderships

headline: Fun Job
pros: Fun employees. Great benefits 401k, medical dental. Office is beautiful and my manager is just wonderful. Very generous with time off.
cons: Room for growth is minimal due to how big the companys is. They need to pay more attention to all.

headline: It was a job at an old company caring more about outdated ideas than changing the world.
pros:
There are smart people that work there. 
The free shwag is somtimes nifty and fun. 
Octoberfest. 
Some interesting products and tools to work with.
cons:
4 layoffs in 4 years (and more to come). 
$30ish stock options that were never worth it.
Despite layoffs there are incompetent teams (team of 10 working for 2 years did what 1 competent person could do in 6 months (no exaggeration there)). 
Apparently you ant fire someone outside of a layoff unless you have a years with of screw ups as evidence. 
Poor decisions by upper management and execs. 
More leaks than a boat made of Swiss cheese. 
Constantly reinventing the wheel except that the wheel they always make is square and they never learn. 
Several teams working to reinvent the same wheel at the same time and don't communicate.

headline: A place where you could maintain good work-life balance.
pros:
1) good perks and benefits
2) upper management that respects employees
3) friendly and usually helpful co-workers 
4) used to be a place of highly competent engineers bu the quality has gone done in the last 2 years 
5) a great place to maintain work-life balance
cons:
1) can be stuck in projects that are not technically challenging
2) little room for career advancement
3) change of focus from upper management that leaves employees with no clear direction
4) level of new hires are overall lower than those that worked there a couple of years ago
5) incompetent first and second line managers

headline: good culture and life-work balance
pros: Very open and flexible company culture. You will come across a bunch of talented individual contributors, which are smart and mostly easy to work with.
cons: Higher management doesn't really know where they should be going, unclear strategy to take the company to the next level. Frequent but useless re org oftens leads to chaos and deteriorated morale.
